docs.text: these days , we are witnessing the deluge of films based on old , cult tv shows .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the times , the fans of these shows shudder thinking what could hollywood hacks of the present do with the memories of their past .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , some five or six years ago , there weren't that many movies and the trend didn't look that depressing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , the people who , like the author of this review , grew up watching flintstones , popular 1960s animated series about " modern stone age " family , weren't particularly worried when the word came about live action remake .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after all , the producer behind the project was steven spielberg and , if anything else , at least the special effects would be good .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot revolves about flintstones , family set in fictious stone age " town " of bedrock , whose members enjoy the lifestyle of 1950s middle class america .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: fred flinstone ( john goodman ) works in the quarry , and one day he helps his best friend and neighbour barney rubble ( rick moranis ) and his wife betty ( rosie o'donnell ) to adopt a baby .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to return the favour , barney switches his results of aptitude test with fred , and , based on that , fred gets well-paid job in management .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , of course , this is just a sham - corrupt official cliff vandercave ( kyle maclachlan ) and his sultry secretary sharon stone ( halle berry ) need a scapegoat for their embezzlement scheme .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the meantime , fred's wife wilma ( elizabeth perkins ) must face her mother ( elizabeth taylor ) who can't stand fred .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: on the superficial level , the flintstones did the excellent job in bringing the animated series to life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: computer effects are flawless , and the costumes , settings and other details are authentic for all the fans of the show .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , problems with this film start with inadequate casting - rick moranis is too thin for the role of barney , while the cartoon betty used to be much skinnier than rosie o'donnell .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the greatest problem of all is plot , or to be precise , the lack of plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some thirty six screenwriters made sure that the plot of the film is lame , original characters one-dimensional , and many elements of the story , like embezzlement and inter-office politics , totally incomprehensible for the little children , the main targeted audience of this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: result is almost unwatchable mess , occasionally saved mostly by excellent acting ( elizabeth perkins was right on mark as wilma ) and one of the classic example of mortal hollywood disease known as " high concept " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after great hype , movie quickly sank into oblivion and the fans of the show returned to the animated version .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all in all , film isn't that bad , but only the hard core fans and nostalgics can find more than guilty pleasure in it .
docs.label: negative
